meanings.definition: The act of extracting juice from fruits or vegetables.
meanings.sent1: I love juicing fresh oranges for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new juicing machine to make healthy drinks.
meanings.sent3: The juicing of lemons for the lemonade stand made the kids very happy.
meanings.sent4: Her juicing of the apples turned them into a delicious drink.
meanings.sent5: The sound of juicing the grapes filled the kitchen with a sweet aroma.

meanings.definition: The process of using performance-enhancing drugs in sports.
meanings.sent1: The athlete was caught juicing before the big race.
meanings.sent2: Juicing in sports is considered cheating and is not allowed.
meanings.sent3: The coach warned the team about the dangers of juicing.
meanings.sent4: His juicing scandal shocked the entire sports community.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of juicing can be severe for athletes.

meanings.definition: The act of making something more exciting or interesting.
meanings.sent1: The juicing of the movie plot with unexpected twists kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent2: Her juicing of the party with fun games made it a huge success.
meanings.sent3: The juicing of the boring meeting with a surprise guest speaker was a hit.
meanings.sent4: His juicing of the story with humor added a new dimension to it.
meanings.sent5: The juicing of the event with live music created a lively atmosphere.
